pullRequest.body:
The one-point compactification of n-dimensional Euclidean space is homeomorphic to the n-sphere.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

### PR summary [b4e92200e0](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18711/commits/b4e92200e0199ce4a634674990d16eedab437ddf)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Compactification.OnePointEquiv`|-1245|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Compactification.OnePoint`|-741|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Compactification.OnePoint.Basic`|741|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Compactification.OnePoint.OnePointEquiv`|1245|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Compactification.OnePoint.Sphere` (new file)|1932|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ OnePointEuclidean_homeo_sphere`
`+ Submodule_homeo_Euclidean`
`+ image_source`
`+ injective_of_source_eq_univ`
`+ injective_stereographic_symm`
`+ injective_symm_of_target_eq_univ`
`+ onePointHyperplaneHomeoUnitSphere`
`+ surjective_of_target_eq_univ`
`+ surjective_stereographic`
`+ surjective_symm_of_source_eq_univ`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

@bjoernkjoshanssen I've been trying to get to this PR for a week but unfortunately I couldn't find the time and I'm going to be traveling for the next ~10 days. If it is still open when I return, I will try to prioritise it.

> @bjoernkjoshanssen I've been trying to get to this PR for a week but unfortunately I couldn't find the time and I'm going to be traveling for the next ~10 days. If it is still open when I return, I will try to prioritise it.

OK, sounds good! I hope this one is not too far off the mark.
@ocfnash merge conflict fixed, interested in having another look?
I'll take a look this evening.
OK thanks @ocfnash I believe I have implemented your suggestions.

Thanks for this work. This is pure topology though so it should not be added to a file about differential geometry.

I think what we should is:

1. create a new directory `Mathlib/Topology/Compactification/OnePoint`,
2. move the file `Mathlib/Topology/Compactification/OnePoint.lean` to `Mathlib/Topology/Compactification/OnePoint/Basic.lean`,
3. place your new results in a new file `Mathlib/Topology/Compactification/OnePoint/Sphere.lean`

You will unfortunately have to import `Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Instances.Sphere` because that is where `stereographic` is defined. I think this should be split out but that this can wait for a subsequent PR.
Please move this close to the definition of the stereographic projection.
Done.

```suggestion
/-- The orthogonal complement of the span of a point on the sphere
is homeomorphic to a Euclidean space of codimension 1. -/
noncomputable def Submodule_homeo_Euclidean {n : ℕ}
    (v : sphere (0 : (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin n.succ))) 1) :
    Homeomorph ((span ℝ {v.1})ᗮ) (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin n)) :=
  letI fact {n : ℕ} : Fact (finrank ℝ (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin n.succ)) = n + 1) := ⟨by simp⟩
  (OrthonormalBasis.fromOrthogonalSpanSingleton n (ne_zero_of_mem_unit_sphere v)).repr.toHomeomorph
```

- We try to have as little global instances of `Fact` as possible. Hence I'm inlining it.
- I don't think the original docstring is what you intended.
Thanks. And sorry about the docstring.

I think we don't need this as (modulo spelling) it is already included in [PartialHomeomorph.isOpenEmbedding_restrict](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/PartialHomeomorph.html#PartialHomeomorph.isOpenEmbedding_restrict).

Indeed
```lean
example (e : PartialHomeomorph X Y) :
    e.toPartialEquiv ∘ ((↑) : e.source → X) = e.source.restrict e :=
  rfl

example (e : PartialHomeomorph X Y) : Continuous (e.source.restrict e) :=
  e.isOpenEmbedding_restrict.continuous
```
Thanks, I was able to make that work.

If we drop the `PartialHomeomorph.continuous_comp_val` lemma we can write:
```suggestion
          · obtain ⟨b,hb⟩ :=
              (stereographic hv).isOpenEmbedding_restrict.continuous.isOpen_preimage s h
```
Yes, that's what I figured.

I think we should regard `stereoInvFun` as an implementation detail en route to `stereographic` and so I think this should be spelled using `stereographic` since it has been constructed by now.

Furthermore I think there is a more basic lemma to abstract, namely:
```lean
lemma PartialEquiv.injective_symm_of_target_eq_univ
    {α β : Type*} (e : PartialEquiv α β) (h : e.target = Set.univ) :
    Injective e.symm := by
  simpa [Set.injective_iff_injOn_univ, h] using e.symm.injOn
```
Using that I think the proof here can be:
```suggestion
theorem injective_stereographic_symm (hv : ‖v‖ = 1) :
    Injective (stereographic hv).symm :=
  (stereographic hv).injective_symm_of_target_eq_univ rfl
```

Just some nitpicks:

- For better or worse our [naming conventions](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html) mean that data-bearing definitions should be `lowerCamelCase`.
- There is a `noncomputable section` above so we can drop the `noncomputable` modifier.
- We have a notation `≃ₜ` for `Homeomorph`
- We have a notation `ℝ ∙ v` for the span of a singleton set.
- We can drop several layers of redundant parentheses here.
```suggestion
def onePointHyperplaneHomeoUnitSphere :
    OnePoint (ℝ ∙ v)ᗮ ≃ₜ sphere (0 : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin n.succ)) 1 := by
```
After this is moved to a new file as you suggest, I'm not sure if there's still a `noncomputable section` open... but I can make it so.

We definitely need to tidy up here:
```suggestion
import Mathlib.Topology.Compactification.OnePoint.Basic
import Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Instances.Sphere
```
Yes, sorry about that.

```suggestion
open Function Metric Module Set Submodule

noncomputable section

variable {n : ℕ} {v : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin n.succ)} (hv : ‖v‖ = 1)
```
The change to drop `hv'` is especially important: otherwise we are repeating ourselves and downstream users will need to supply redundant proofs.
OK, thanks.

If we use just `noncomputable section` above then we don't need this here.
```suggestion
```
Not even an "end"? Somehow reminds me of PHP programming. :)

We should leave this file alone now that we're not adding anything.
```suggestion
```
Oops, yes thanks.

I might golf this proof later but for now at least the following will get it working after dropping `hv'` as a `variable`
```suggestion
  have hv' : v ∈ sphere 0 (1:ℝ) := by simpa
  apply OnePoint.equivOfIsEmbeddingOfRangeEq (f := stereoInvFun hv)
```

This should not be here (people who wish to use this lemma should not need to depend on facts about stereographic projection / the smooth structure of the sphere).

Please relocate it to somewhere appropriate in `Mathlib/Logic/Equiv/PartialEquiv.lean`

Additionally this lemma is really one of four and if we add one we should add them all so that there is a consistent API for future consumers. They are:

1. if `e.target = Set.univ` then `Surjective e`
2. if `e.target = Set.univ` then `Injective e.symm` [the one you currently have]
3. if `e.source = Set.univ` then `Injective e`
4. if `e.source = Set.univ` then `Surjective e.symm`
OK done, I found one-liners for each of the four, not sure if they are considered optimal though.
If we add this, we should also add a lemma stating `Surjective (stereogrphic hv)`
Done!

I think this isn't really the right definition. It only applies to the very specific concrete type `EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin n)` whereas there is a homeomorphism for any `n`-dimensional real space. I think the right statement would be:
```suggestion
/-- A homeomorphism from the one-point compactification of affine space to the sphere. -/
noncomputable def onePointEquivSphereOfFinrankEq (V : Type*) [AddCommGroup V] [Module ℝ V]
    [TopologicalSpace V] [TopologicalAddGroup V] [ContinuousSMul ℝ V] [T2Space V]
    (h : finrank ℝ V = n) :
    OnePoint V ≃ₜ sphere (0 : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin (n + 1))) 1 :=
  sorry
```
You'll need to use [FiniteDimensional.nonempty_continuousLinearEquiv_of_finrank_eq](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Module/FiniteDimension.html#FiniteDimensional.nonempty_continuousLinearEquiv_of_finrank_eq) and because `V` is abstract you won't have an interpretation of this as stereographic projection but you have that in `onePointHyperplaneHomeoUnitSphere` if anyone ever wants it.
What would `FiniteDimensional.nonempty_continuousLinearEquiv_of_finrank_eq` be applied to?

I was imaging something like this:
```lean
/-- A homeomorphism from the one-point compactification of affine space to the sphere. -/
noncomputable def onePointEquivSphereOfFinrankEq {ι V : Type*} [Fintype ι]
    [AddCommGroup V] [Module ℝ V] [FiniteDimensional ℝ V]
    [TopologicalSpace V] [TopologicalAddGroup V] [ContinuousSMul ℝ V] [T2Space V]
    (h : finrank ℝ V + 1 = Fintype.card ι) :
    OnePoint V ≃ₜ sphere (0 : EuclideanSpace ℝ ι) 1 := by
  let n := Fintype.card ι - 1
  have hn : n + 1 = Fintype.card ι := by omega
  let E := EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin (n + 1))
  let v : E := EuclideanSpace.single 0 1
  have hv : ‖v‖ = 1 := by simp [v, E]
  let e₁ : EuclideanSpace ℝ ι ≃ₗᵢ[ℝ] E :=
    LinearIsometryEquiv.piLpCongrLeft 2 ℝ ℝ (hn ▸ Fintype.equivFin ι)
  let e₂ : OnePoint (ℝ ∙ v)ᗮ ≃ₜ sphere (0 : E) 1 := onePointHyperplaneHomeoUnitSphere hv
  have hV : finrank ℝ V = finrank ℝ (ℝ ∙ v)ᗮ := by
    -- `finrank_orthogonal_span_singleton` + some fiddling
    sorry
  let e₃ : V ≃ₜ (ℝ ∙ v)ᗮ :=
    (FiniteDimensional.nonempty_continuousLinearEquiv_of_finrank_eq hV).some.toHomeomorph
  let e₄ : sphere (0 : E) 1 ≃ₜ sphere (0 : EuclideanSpace ℝ ι) 1 := by
    -- use `e₁`
    sorry
  exact (Homeomorph.onePointCongr e₃).trans (e₂.trans e₄)
```
That is very messy (and not quite complete) but hopefully gives the idea.
I don't see how to prove that. "sorry" in a different sense :)

pullRequest.title: feat: One-point compactification of Euclidean space homeomorphic to sphere

source.title: feat(Topology/Compactification): projective line over ℝ is homeomorphic to the one-point compactification of ℝ
